description:
## Context

Data about access to education and training for persons with disability in Europe. Source is https://ec.europa.eu/eurostat/data/database (official European Data Source). Data is downloaded from the source. 

## Content

### Original data

The original data (hlth_de040.tsv) is provided in TSV (tab delimited) format.
Unit used is THS (thousands).
Data contains information about access to education and training for people with disability by country and year in Europe.
The time unit used are years. Geography is at country level (in Europe) .

Disability levels present in the data are according to the European classification (that can be consulted at http://dd.eionet.europa.eu/vocabulary/eurostat/hlth_pb/view): 

* PB1040 - Difficulty in basic activities
* PB1041 - No difficulty in basic activities  
* PB1070 - Limitation in work caused by a health condition or difficulty in a basic activity  
* PB1071 - No limitation in work caused by a health condition or difficulty in basic activities
* TOTAL  

Education attainment levels are according to [ISCED-97 International classification](http://uis.unesco.org/sites/default/files/documents/international-standard-classification-of-education-1997-en_0.pdf).

### Transformed data

The transformed data (`education_disabled_eu.csv`) is in csv format. The geographical data was pivoted using [Starter Kernel: Education Access for Disabled](https://www.kaggle.com/gpreda/starter-kernel-educaton-access-for-disabled) Kernel.

## How to

The original data has the temporal information given as columns (per year). In order to further use this data, it would be more easy to pivot first these columns to get instead date/value pairs. This pivot operation, using `melt` from `pandas` is done in the starter kernel:
* [Starter Kernel: Education Access for Disabled](https://www.kaggle.com/gpreda/starter-kernel-educaton-access-for-disabled) ;  we convert the year to an integer. Just run this Kernel to put the data in csv format, with yearly data pivoted.

## Acknowledgements

All merit for data collection, curation, and initial publishing goes to [Eurostat](https://ec.europa.eu/eurostat/data/database).

## Inspiration

You can use this data for various demographic, social, health conditions analysis about Europe, combining with alternative data from Kaggle and other sources.
